I worked in epidemic tracking, so there's only been one human disease which has been eradicated in the last 75 years, and that's smallpox.
In the same period of time, we have greatly increased air travel, and so the possibility of global epidemics has greatly increased.
So for almost every epidemic of the modern age, we were able to go back and find open reports about that outbreak well before it was identified by health professionals.
So in the case of bird flu, we can see reports coming out of Asia weeks before it was identified as a new illness for swine flu H1N1.
We can see reports in local papers in Mexico.
